description: Erection of a two storey rear extension on top of existing two storey extension, with roof terrace on each additional storey.
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposed erection of a full width second floor rear extension by reason of its design, scale, bulk and massing is considered to form an overdominant and harmful development. The proposed development would visually dominate the host building to the detriment of the existing character and appearance of the host building, wider terrace and its conservation setting. The proposed development is therefore considered contrary to policy PPS 5; policies 7.4 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2011, policy 9 of Islingtonâ€™s Core Strategy 2011, policies D4 (Designing in context), D11 (Alterations and extensions), D24 (Materials), D28 (Rear extensions) of Islington's Unitary Development Plan 2002, Islington's Urban Design Guide (2006) and the Roseberry Avenue Conservation Guidelines.
